pr_title: Pull request for an additional customizable option in grappling hooks

timeline.message:
Grappling hook edit

[+] Added a setting to allow the grappling hook to stay in inventory instead of being dropped on the floor on use

final commit

[+] desired feature fully implemented
[+] set the default value to false
[+] now added option does not mess with despawn-seconds
[+] added keepinv boolean to the functions

timeline.bodyText:
Please follow the naming convention for fields, this should be in "pascal case", so "stayInInvOnUse".
Other than that I think the name is a little confusing, I think something like consumeOnUse (which would actually be the opposite here) would make more sense and is much more user-friendly.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Please don't use the boxed Boolean class, use the primitive boolean instead.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: Pascal case, so keepInInv, or with the suggested reversal: wasConsumed may be more fitting.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.message:
Made requested changes

[+] Used a better name for the boolean
[+] replaced Boolean with primitive boolean
[+] Used pascal naming system

timeline.bodyText: Comments should be made on the line above the code, never right next to it.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit

timeline.bodyText: This comment should be made above the if-statement or inside of it.
timeline.author: TheBusyBiscuit
